channel.title: blog on pott.dev
channel.description: Recent content in blog on pott.dev

item.title: Testing asynchronous code
item.description: From time to time developers must write asynchronous code. This can for example be to access a database or make a network call. Writing asynchronous code is getting easier and easier. And Languages and frameworks provide better tools than ever - What a time to be a developer!. There is only one thing, which still remains true for the most cases: Testing asynchronous code in isolation can be really difficult. We will make it look easy for Kotlin with a simple trick.

item.title: Introducing myself
item.description: Who am I? My name is Johannes Ptaszyk. I located and born in Bottrop, Germany and I identify as european. Also I identify as the following: Software developer Political being Nature lover Music lover What do I do? Currently I am working as a Junior in the Android development team at G Data Software AG. I recently joined the german party Bündnis 90/Die Grünen to bring some new ideas to the german politics. What is this website about?
